content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code to clean a column name:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[ -]" => "_")
end
```
This function works by first converting the string to lower case, then removing any leading or trailing white spaces using `strip`. The `replace` function is used with a regular expression to replace all spaces and hyphens with underscores.
